meanings.definition: A person who raises or cares for young children or animals.
meanings.sent1: The rearers at the daycare center ensure the children are safe and happy.
meanings.sent2: The rearers on the farm feed the baby animals and keep them warm.
meanings.sent3: The rearers organized a fun playdate for the kids at the park.
meanings.sent4: The rearers of the puppies showered them with love and attention.
meanings.sent5: The rearers sang lullabies to the babies to help them sleep.

meanings.definition: A person who trains or educates others.
meanings.sent1: The dog rearers taught the new owners how to train their puppy.
meanings.sent2: The horse rearers worked with the riders to improve their skills.
meanings.sent3: The rearers shared interesting facts with the students during the class.
meanings.sent4: The rearers of the team instilled a sense of discipline and teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The rearers guided the learners through each step of the process.

meanings.definition: A structure or device used to support or elevate something.
meanings.sent1: The rearers of the swing set were sturdy and well-built.
meanings.sent2: The rearers of the shelf kept the books neatly organized.
meanings.sent3: The rearers of the ladder made it easier to reach the high shelves.
meanings.sent4: The rearers of the platform ensured a stable base for the performers.
meanings.sent5: The rearers of the bridge provided a safe passage over the river.
